Physical Games.title: My Happy Healthy Rich and Windy Chicago Game
Physical Games.description: My Happy Healthy Windy Chicago Life is a one-player simulation card game. This game is about life and daily activities, based on my personal experience living in Chicago. The objective of this game is to survive and be healthy and happy. It is a small and seemingly simple goal but can be challenging to achieve, both in-game and in real life. It aims to make players have fun, while also allowing them to reflect on their own life through playing this simulated life experience.

Physical Games.title: Fangs: The Eternal Coven
Physical Games.description: Fangs is an original strategy board game set in a mysterious mountain town where players compete as vampires striving to grow the most powerful coven. Blending resource management, chance-based actions, and character development, the game invites players to navigate a world filled with humans, socialites, rituals, and supernatural politics. This game combines stylized visual design, tactical decision-making, and a darkly playful atmosphere to create an immersive and competitive tabletop experience.

Interactive Sketches.title: Garden:Flowers & Fireworks
Interactive Sketches.description: An interactive digital garden where users can plant flowers or create fireworksby clicking . Created using P5.js, creating a visual experience that celebrates creativity and nature.

Interactive Sketches.title: Virtual Toilet
Interactive Sketches.description: An interactive digital art piece where users can interact with a toilet model using their body movements detected by PoseNet. Created using P5.js and PoseNet, this project explores the intersection of technology, humor, and everyday objects.

Interactive Sketches.title: Mirrors
Interactive Sketches.description: An interactive digital art project allowing audiences to view their reflections creatively. Created using P5.js and PoseNet, this project explores identity and self-perception.

Digital Games.title: Human? Alien? Vegetables!
Digital Games.description: Human? Alien? Vegetables! is an interactive sci-fi game about the displacement of the human body and its environment. The character is abducted by aliens and taken aboard their UFO for experimental purposes. Ultimately, the game challenges players to consider the true nature of humanity and identity.

Digital Games.title: The Alley
Digital Games.description: The Alley is a first-person exploration game where players navigate through a mysterious alley filled with surreal and dreamlike environments. It transports players into a whimsical realm filled with various scenes that highlight a unique sense of playfulness.  A hidden doorway leads into a world where everyday objects reveal their enchanting nature — a fish tank becomes a portal, a disco ball hovers, and mystical creatures dance. This magical space celebrates fantasy.

Digital Games.title: Go! Groundshel
Digital Games.description: Go Groundshel! is a puzzle adventure game. In this project I am responsible for designing and creating the updated game environment, user interface, and implementing the art assets into the Unity engine. The game features a cute charming art style and engaging gameplay mechanics that challenge players to navigate through various levels while solving puzzles and overcoming obstacles.

3D Animations.title: Light Ocean
3D Animations.description: Animations are motion captured and acted by myself. The blue represents the liberated mind dancing through open space; the orange is the physical body that needs rest and safety.

3D Animations.title: Forest Illusion
3D Animations.description: In a mythical forest, a shimmering bubble embodies the delicate balance of ecosystems, swirling with vibrant life. As its turbulence grows, reflecting the forest’s essence, it eventually bursts, releasing a cascade of light that ignites a surreal transformation. This animation uses visual effects to explore themes of nature's fragility and the profound impact of environmental change.

Visual Designs.title: Witches House
Visual Designs.description: Animations are motion captured and acted by myself. The blue represents the liberated mind dancing through open space; the orange is the physical body that needs rest and safety.
